alert.note: Alert for Cascade County below 5000ft; Judith Basin County and Judith Gap; Little Belt and Highwood Mountains; Meagher County Valleys; Western and Central Chouteau County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 11:02PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Meagher, northwestern Judith Basin, western Fergus, southern Chouteau and Cascade Counties through 1145 PM MDT... At 1101 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southeast of Highwood, or 24 miles south of Fort Benton, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail and periods of localized heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Great Falls, Fort Benton, Stanford, Belt, Geraldine, Highwood, Black Eagle, Geyser, Carter, Floweree, Eden, Stockett, First Peoples Buffalo Jump State Park, Shonkin, Loma, Ulm, Raynesford, Monarch, Portage, and Sluice Boxes State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
